content:
I apologize if my responses were not satisfactory. I can understand your frustration. For reliable information on the effectiveness of strategies being implemented in Bridgeport's public schools, you can try reaching out to the following resources:

1. Bridgeport Public Schools administration: You can contact the public schools administration directly to inquire about the effectiveness of their initiatives and relevant data sets.

2. Connecticut State Department of Education: The Connecticut State Department of Education can provide information on state-level policies and data collection methods.

3. Local education advocacy groups: Education advocacy groups can provide relevant resources and may be able to provide feedback on which approaches have seen the most success.

4. Local universities or research institutions: Researchers from local universities or research institutions may have conducted studies on the effectiveness of initiatives in Bridgeport's public schools.

It may be helpful to contact multiple sources in order to gather a comprehensive view of the effectiveness of strategies being implemented in Bridgeport's public schools.
